resources.string: If you have not registered register now!!!
Please read the following instructions carefully
1.Total duration of the examination is 180 minutes.

2.The clock will be set at the server.The countdown timer in the middle of the screen will display the remaining time available for you to complete the exam. When the timer reaches zero, the examination will end by itself.You will not be required to end or submit your examination.
3. The question palette displayed on the right side of screen will show the status of each question using one of the following symbols:
You have not answered the question, but have visited it.
You have marked the question for review.
You have not selected any option for the answer and saved it.
You have answered the question and saved it.

The Marked for Review status for a question simply indicates that you would like to look at that question again. If a question is answered and Marked for Review,your answer for that question will not be considered in the evaluation.
4.To answer a question, do the following:
a)Click on the question number in the Question Palette to go to that question directly.
b)Select an answer for a multiple choice type question.Use the virtual numeric keypad to enter a number as answer for a numerical type question.

c)Click on Save and Next to save your answer for the current question and then go to the next question. Saving the answer means that your answer will be considered for evaluation. The answer may also be saved without any option being selected.
d)Click on Mark for Review and Next to save your answer for the current question, mark it for review, and then go to the next question.
e)CAUTION:NOTE THAT YOUR ANSWER FOR THE CURRENT QUESTION WILL NOT BE SAVED,IF YOU NAVIGATE TO ANOTHER QUESTION DIRECTLY BY CLICKING ON ITS QUESTION NUMBER.
5. You can view all the questions by clicking on the Question Paper button.Note that the options for multiple choice type questions will not be shown.
WHICHEVER OPTION YOU THINK IS RIGHT, CLICK THE RADIO BUTTON CORRESPONDING TO THAT OPTION
Click on the button below to see a detailed analysis of your performance
6. The Marking Scheme for the test is:
CHOOSE YOUR MODE FOR THE EXAM
6. The final score is calculated as per the following rules :
a) If the answer is correct, +3 marks is added to the score.
b) If the answer is wrong, 1 mark is deducted from the score, i.e. a negative -1 mark is added . Hence, there will be penalties for guesswork leading to wrong answers.
c) If no option is selected, no marks will be deducted from the current score i.e. the current score remains unchanged.
